# The Problem
.center[![reddit](https://logos-download.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/Reddit_logo_full_1-700x227.png)]

**Goal:** Update knowledge of average post karma given new data


Assumptions:
$$X \sim \mathcal{N}(\theta,\,\sigma^{2})\,$$
$$\mu_{1} \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu_{\theta},\,\sigma^{2}_{\theta})\,$$

$$f(\mu|X) \propto f(X|\mu)f(\mu)$$
---
# The Solution

$$X \sim \mathcal{N}(84,\,25)\,$$
$$\mu_{1} \sim \mathcal{N}(19,\,8)\,$$

```{r code, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
plot_bayes_norm <- function() {
   ...
   n <- 1L
      # calculate posterior mean
      post_mu <-
         ((prior_mu / prior_sigma ^ 2) + ((n * data_mu) / data_sigma ^ 2)) /
         ((1 / prior_sigma ^ 2) + (n / data_sigma ^ 2))
      # calculate posterior variance
      post_sigma <-
         sqrt(1 / ((1 / prior_sigma ^ 2) + (n / data_sigma ^ 2)))
      # to center plot on posterior
      y <- seq(post_mu - 8 * post_sigma,
               post_mu + 8 * post_sigma,
               length.out = 500)
      # create normal density distribution based on prior params
      y_prior <- dnorm(y, prior_mu, prior_sigma)
      ...
}      
```
